heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.0°C), outside temperature (down 2.6°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 218 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 352 m) and inside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 218.3m lower than yesterday, 10.1m higher than the past week, 352.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1039m and a peak of 2260m, averaging 1248.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 2.0°C lower than yesterday, 0.7°C lower than the past week, 0.2°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday, dew point temperatures hit a low of 7.1°C and a high of 11.4°C, averaging 8.3°C; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
